attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: More citizen, human and working rights lessons into the educational curriculum
attributes.background: a lot of blood and tears was spilled building the cornerstones of what rights we enjoy today as humans, citizens and workers. Unfortunately a lot of young people miss out on this vital information and children should be educated about what rights they have so they are prepared for the real world

attributes.action: Lower the drinking age to 16.
attributes.background: 16 is the legal age of consent and if you are thought resonsible enough to have a sexual relationship why aren't you thought responsible enough to drink safely?
attributes.additional_details: At the age of 16 you have finished high school and are staring sixthform or starting an apprenticeship. At this age you are responsible enough to handle money and know right from wrong.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for supermarket chains to display air miles on fruit.
attributes.background: Fresh fruit often travels to the UK by air, which creates huge amounts of CO2. People need the information on packaging to make choices and reduce their CO2 footprint.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people do not realise the CO2  of their food, especially when it travels by air. Aeroplanes are huge contributors to climate change.
Providing the air travel information on fruit packaging would give people the tools to reduce their CO2 footprint, and help us stop climate change.

attributes.action: More funding for the treatment of schizophrenia and chronic mental illnesses.
attributes.background: It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the uk have a mental illness of some kind during their lifetime. At any one time about 220,000 people are being treated directly for schizophrenia in the UK by the NHS. Sufferers have the highest rates of suicide partly due to the Ill side effects of neuroleptic
attributes.additional_details:
More funding is needed to find a possible alternative to antipsychotics like cbd oil which has the potential to cure the disease short term without the side effects associated with neuroleptics.

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/ministryofhemp.com/blog/cbd-for-schizophrenia/amp/

https://www.livingwithschizophreniauk.org/facts-and-figures/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-17940070

attributes.action: Fund research into Granuloma Annulare
attributes.background: Granuloma Annulare is a skin condition which causes an unsightly rash and severe itching and there is no known cure for it.
attributes.additional_details: I run a Facebook page for this condition and have hundreds of members all who are getting nowhere in the UK when they go to see a dermatologist. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Naturalisation fees should be reduced significantly, especially for refugees.
attributes.background: Paying fees for Naturalisation or Citizenship, became a nightmare for all people and especially refugees. Family of 5 people have to pay around Â£6000 to 7000.

attributes.action: Increase the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p across the UK
attributes.background: It takes up to 1000 years for a plastic bag to decompose in landfills. Over 100 million marine animals die each year due to plastic in the oceans and other water systems. The 5p bag charge reduced plastic bag usuage by 85% but 2.1 billion bags were still sold between April 2016 and April 2017.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for signs to be placed 1000m before a mobile speed trap
attributes.background: Make a legal requirement for temperary signs to be placed 1000m before a mobile speed camera. This is to insure the safety of officers who may be roadside performing speed checks. By making road users aware that officers and equipment will be near by, Drivers can make precautions when driving past.

attributes.action: Make health and nutrition a compulsory subject at Key Stage 2 and 3 level.
attributes.background: Childhood obesity is at its highest level ever in the UK and this is mainly due to a combination of lack of education in the majority of both adults and children, and misinformation spread by companies in order to sell products. By incorporating these subject in to KS2 and 3 it is providing the next
attributes.additional_details: Generation with the ability to make correctly informed choices about the foods they choose to consume.

attributes.action: Keep British Summer Time (BST) all year round in UK
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST or Daylight Saving Time - DST) is 1 hour ahead of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). The UK has BST from late March to late October.  With BST there are lighter evenings, darker mornings, but lighter afternoons, greater happiness, fewer accidents and increased productivity

attributes.action: Government to make lie detector tests compulsory for suspects.
attributes.background: The main aim of this petition is to persuade government and parliament to make lie detector tests complusory on suspects also lie detector tests should be carried out without the permission of suspects as a routine check.
attributes.additional_details: Innocent lives are lost and the families want to find out who the suspect may have been. Cases of crime and violence will be easier to resolve and justice will be given to innocent families.

attributes.action: Portable barbecues, not disposed of safely, start wildfires. Restrict their sale
attributes.background: Many wildfires start with a hot disposable barbecue left to smoulder. They should be sold responsibly with clear, robust advice about the risks. And proper advice about the very real risk of wild fires.
attributes.additional_details:
Iâve just seen a serious moorland fire which lasted for several
Days. It was started by a disposable barbecue left in a car park. Supposedly extinguished but resurrected by breezes. Causing risk to local
Property and residents, firefighters, farm animals and wild life

attributes.action: Give disabled young people more support to get on the housing ladder
attributes.background:
The young persons network in Herefordshire which supports young people to have a voice would like government to consider supporting young people to get onto the housing ladder.

This could be by making more homes accessible throughout the uk and offering funding packages specifically targeted YP
attributes.additional_details:
Our lead was been trying to live independently in a rented/brought house, but has struggled to find suitable housing in his local area.

The only option that he has found so far is buying a house and then having it adapted to suit his needs this could cost thousands.

Unfortunately he is not the only disabled young person in this position thousands of young disabled people across the uk want to live independently in there own home.

I want the govt to make funding ready for accessible homes

attributes.action: Establish quorum and meaningful majority criteria to validate future referenda.
attributes.background: Referendums are affecting the future of the UK. A 50.1% majority is slight and have left nearly half the electorate unsatisfied and discontented. Criteria such as the definition of a quorum would establish the initial validity of the referendum and more accurately reflect the will of the electorate.

attributes.action: Introduce a Licencing system for cyclists and tighten up cycle law.
attributes.background:
Recently a facebook post caused horror and cyclists regularly show little regard for other road users and the law.

Please debate introducing a licence, at least with theory tests similar to other vehicles, which all cyclists must pass and must carry at all times and have 3rd party insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
I once received verbal abuse from a cyclist feeling I was in the wrong. I had dash cam footage reviewed by the police who were horrified how many highway code points the cyclist broke. The cyclist could not be traced so no action was taken but it's typical of the lack of knowledge of cyclists.

I am a horse rider, cyclist, motorcyclist, and car driver. The group I see least consideration for road users and frequent law breaking is cyclists.

attributes.action: Allow the practice of euthanasia in the UK.
attributes.background: Euthanasia should be a human right for those who need and deserve the right to die. No human being deserves to suffer from an illness with no potential for recovery. It should be a choice for all critically unwell individuals if they wish to be euthanised.
attributes.additional_details:
In dire circumstances, it should be available for UK citizens to have the choice or their families to have the choice for an ill individual to die with dignity, to end suffering for the person of ill health. 
In the UK under ASPA (Animals : Scientific Procedures Act) 1986, there is a requirement to euthanise animals in order to prevent undue suffering. If this is legally viewed as a right and a requirement for mice, rats etc. why not for humans?

attributes.action: Parliament to set aside time to debate the rules whereby MPs put forward bills
attributes.background: Following the wrecking of two bills which had received extensive scrutiny by departments, and were supported by ministers, by a single MP calling "object" on a Friday afternoon, time should be set aside by Parliament to consider and amend the rules whereby MPs can introduce bills to the House.
attributes.additional_details: A single MP is currently able to wreck private members' bills by talking them out, or objecting.

attributes.action: Mobility scooters users should be licenced, insured and pass a handling test.
attributes.background: To help prevent more members of the general public being injured, as i was recently, by one of these large, heavy, unregulated vehicles driven without due care in public places.

attributes.action: Don't Raise Income Tax to pay for NHS - Find Alternative Source of Funds
attributes.background: Research has suggested that income tax may have to rise, by as much as Â£2,000 per household, to meet the future needs of the NHS. This would be unacceptable when the public is struggling to even scrape by.

attributes.action: More help available for people who are suffering with mental health issues
attributes.background:
For many of us with mental health we have been failed by the services on offer within the NHS, We are often the ones left to one side. 

Offer more help to people who are admitted to A&E 

make more beds available in hospitals for people with mental health instead of sending us home to suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
We need early intervention available instead of being left until itâs simply to late. 

We need more beds available as many of us who attend A&E are often told that no beds are available or are not even offered one. 

Data compiled for the BBC by NHS Digital showed that between 2011-12 and 2015-16 the number of patients attending A&E units with psychiatric problems rose by nearly 50% to 165,000.

For the under 18s alone the numbers almost doubled to nearly 22,000.

attributes.action: Impose a maximum booking fee on online cinema ticket purchases.
attributes.background: Some cinemas can charge upwards of Â£1.75 on top of the price of a ticket just to book it online instead of at the cinema which is blatantly extortionate. A reasonable cap either as a fixed amount or as a percentage of the ticket price should be imposed.

attributes.action: Revamp the House of Lords to only 400 members all of whom are Life Peers.
attributes.background: The House of Lords has become far too large for its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Only the Chinese government has a bigger second chamber than the UK - which is absurd. The House of Lords no longer represents its national needs.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for food products to have carbon print and water usage labels
attributes.background:
The current rate of climate change is having devastating effects on the planet with natural disasters becoming more commonplace.
Some food products are much more carbon and water intensive in production than others and having these labels will allow us to be more informed.
attributes.additional_details:
With around 10% of the UKâs carbon emissions in 2016 coming from domestic agriculture https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/679334/2016_Final_Emissions_Statistics_one_page_summary.pdf
we should consider ways in which to reduce this.

Companies like Tesco once opted to add carbon labels to some food products on a voluntary basis; however, they then dropped this policy in part due to other retailers failing to follow suit.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for apprentices to at least Â£6
attributes.background: Currently the minimum wage for apprentices is Â£3.70. This means that if an apprentice works 40 hours per week, they will only receive Â£7,696 a year. This is not enough money to live off and does not provide a big enough incentive for school levers to start work and have a successful career.

attributes.action: Give equal survivor pension benefits to widows and widowers of female teachers.
attributes.background: Men and women have always paid equal contributions into the teachers' pension scheme. However, widowers of women teachers continue to receive lower amounts than widows of men teachers. The DfE recently announced that spouses / civil partners of same-sex couples will receive equal benefits to widows.
attributes.additional_details:
The bereaved spouses of teachers receive different levels of pension benefits, depending on gender and sexual orientation. Men married to women are disadvantaged compared to those in all other legal relationships. Survivors receive 50% of their partner's pension accrued since 1972. However, only contributions since 1988 count towards survivor benefits for the husbands of female teachers. 
See: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/occupational-pension-schemes-review-of-survivor-benefits

attributes.action: Government should continue annual  breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.background: Current Breast cancer follow-up includes yearly mammogram with breast examination with a breast surgeon and request additional tests for 5 years. NHS has now started implementing new open access (stratified) follow up pathway with no  annual breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.additional_details: Patients will only have a mammogram and no breast examination by surgeon.Ladies has to rely on their own examination skills, which is very dangerous.This will risk patients lives. Mammograms are not sensitive and needs to be complemented by breast examination and other investigations +_ tissue sampling.Govt should continue annual mandatory breast examinations  by breast surgeon and stop implementing this dangerous stratified followup pathway.

attributes.action: Scrap driving theory test
attributes.background: The theory test is a waste of time, effort and most importantly money. I think it should be removed for good.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Subsidy on "free from" products for people with food allergies
attributes.background: After having a child who is food intolerant to several things including dairy, wheat and fish & meeting several people in similar positions who all struggle to get anything on prescription, I want to petition for the Government to provide a subsidy for these expensive but necessary items.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Start supplementing milk with Vitamin D.
attributes.background: Many countries supplement their milk supply with vitamin d and the UK which rarely gets sunshine does not.
attributes.additional_details: There has been evidence showing that many in the UK suffer from vitamin d deficiencies.

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits Â£Â£Â£ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check childrenâs heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously canât take this anymore.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Introduce a standardised 'no added sugar' label
attributes.background: Being in the situation of needing to make lifestyle changes and cutting down on sugar, it turned out to be a lot more difficult to find food and drinks without added sugar than expected. Most processed food contains added sugar, not just the obvious sweets, cake and fizzy drinks!
attributes.additional_details: The red, amber and green food labelling has made it easier to identify healthier food and drinks but added sugar can still only be identified by going through the list of ingredients. In a time of increasing numbers of diabetes, obesity, cancer and other conditions a healthy lifestyle should be made easy. Natural sugar is still sugar but the way healthier option as it comes combined with nutrients.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
attributes.background:
We have many paedophile hunting groups trying to tackle this problem 
Protecting our children should be priority number one
attributes.additional_details:
Currently over 100 hunting groups in the UK because the Police don't have the resources
Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
We have Parents taking to the streets in a bid to expose online predators because our current system does not scratch the surface

attributes.action: I want to start a petition to ban fixed odds betting machines in all book makers
attributes.background: I want to ban all fixed odd gaming machine in all bookmakers. I think these machines exploit people and the human brain, these bookmakers spend thousands of pounds in doing this. People have ruined thier own lives and people around them lives by playing these highly addictive machines.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: More funding for a cure for patients suffering with IBD
attributes.background: The two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease are Crohnâs disease and ulcerative colitis. Both are chronic diseases that cause inflammation of the digestive system. As well as these intestinal problems, the disease may be associated with abnormalities of the joints, eyes, liver and skin.
attributes.additional_details: Crohnâs disease is the inflammation of the digestive system which leads to diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness and weight loss. Ulcerative colitis is a lifelong disease that is associated with significant morbidity. With Ulcerative Colitis being the most common of the two most patients are diagnosed under the age of 25. Having the start of our lives filled with doctors appointments, hospital apppointments, to be used on clinical trials for drugs that can only surpress and not cure our illness.

attributes.action: Make the Care Certificate a mandatory minimum qualification for all care staff
attributes.background:
The Care Certificate course, an outcome of the Cavendish review back in 2013, has still not been made mandatory training for care workers.

In fact, there is still no mandatory minimum level of training for care workers and no quality assurance for training in the care industry.
attributes.additional_details:
In the childcare industry, a nursery must ensure 50% of their workforce are trained to a minimum of Level 2 NVQ for the protection of the children in their care. Aside from DBS checks, many carers are providing care to elderly people in their homes where they live alone, and are doing so without a minimum level of skill.

As we face the realities of an aging population in the UK, what price do we put on providing the best possible care for our elderly relatives, friends, and relatives?

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.
https://food.ndtv.com/opinions/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarket-boycott-as-milk-price-falls-1204828
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/aug/06/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarkets-boycott-as-milk-price-falls
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/price-of-milk-to-go-up-after-dairy-closures-tr220h3sr

attributes.action: Make MPs provide an annual report to constituents on the work they've done
attributes.background: We are often told by politicians of their intentions at the time they wish for a vote, but accountability is often lost between elections. I ask that all politicians be required to provide a full, non election based report to all constituents on the progress they make on their pledges and beyond.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools/colleges to start lessons before 10AM
attributes.background: Child sleep disorders in the uk are on the rise. More and more children are developing mental health issues and their attitude, attendance and grades are getting worse. All because of one thing. School starting early. Most schools in the uk start their lessons around 8:30 and this is way too early.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize Â£522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools
